Temperature Checks Are Becoming the New Normal. Do They Work? ...  lead to invasion of privacy or even civil rights violations. Here's a rundown of what we know so far about the benefits and drawbacks of temperature checks—and the privacy concerns that come with them. Temperature checks won't catch everyone who has COVID-19. Epidemiologist Mackenzie Weise, an infection prevention clinical program manager with the healthcare software company Wolters Kluwer Health, notes that while temperature screenings will pick up on a subset of infected people, many carriers will be asymptomatic or presymptomatic when their temperature is taken.
